snippet.title: Fashion Q&A with Ajak Deng: 'I don't know how fashion will get over its obsession with fame'
snippet.content:
Born in Sudan, raised in Melbourne and now living in New York, Ajak Deng made her runway debut at Melbourne Spring Fashion Week a decade ago while in year 12 and has since walked for the likes of Louis Vuitton, Givenchy and Jean Paul Gaultier. Ranked in the top 10 black models by Vogue Italia last year, Ajak is the face of Melbourne Spring Fashion Week 2017.Photo: Jesse-Leigh Elford Why did you become a model? I wanted to join the army but my teachers at Kurunjang Secondary College told me no, that it wouldn't be for me. They knew I loved to travel and had a thing for fashion and suggested modelling. I have not looked back. What have the highlights been? Doing a Marc Jacobs beauty campaign, and one for Clinique make-up was also a good opportunity. I also became the face of Barney's New York this year, a face for M.A.C Cosmetics, and did covers for Harper's Bazaar Arabia, V Magazine and Vogue Italia.
Michael Lo Sordo dress, $980, from Net-a-Porter. Dinosaur Designs earrings, $330. Photo: Jesse-Leigh Elford
How is Instagram changing modelling? Sadly, the more Instagram followers you have, the more work you get. Being a model isn't enough. If you have 100,000-plus followers, you are considered somebody. I don't know how the fashion industry will ever come back from this obsession with fame.
Ginger & Smart 'Camille' gown, $2399. Celine hoop earrings, $585, and 'Barbelle' earrings, $745, from Parlour X. Louis Vuitton Lock Me Supple bracelet, $700, and 'Nanogram' ring, $980. Tony Bianco 'Davis' boots, $220. Photo: Jesse-Leigh Elford
Who are some of your favourite Australian designers? I love Zimmerman for its sexy cool. If I want edgy and a don't-mess-with-me look, Toni Maticevski. I am also a big fan of Alice McCall - I love her dresses.
Dion Lee dress, $890. Ellery earrings, POA. Photo: Jesse-Leigh Elford
You've been doing lots of editorial work - is the runway still your top priority? I am a runway girl 100 per cent. I am a total showgirl. Who are the kindest people you've worked with in the fashion industry? I love Jean-Paul Gaultier for his one-on-one time. He comes to the fittings, talks to you and gets you a cup of tea and a biscuit. He is so loving and genuine. Alexander Wang is another. I was also in a fashion shoot with singer Bruno Mars and he turned up with three trays of chicken wings for lunch. What a guy!
Kate Sylvester "Colette" dungarees, $499. Louis Vuitton "Idol V Crew" necklace, $1240, "Essential V" cuff, $1330, and "Lock Me Supple" bracelet, $700. Photo: Jesse-Leigh Elford
BEAUTY TIP For an uplifting sweep of eyeshadow, go for gold. Try Sephora Colorful Eyeshadow in Gold Heart Melbourne Spring Fashion Week runs from September 1-7. Fashion editor, Penny McCarthy; photography, Jesse-Leigh Elford; hair, Brad Mullins using O&M; make-up, Filomena Natoli using M.A.C Cosmetics; fashion assistant, Archie Pham.

sindex.name: Parlour X. Louis Vuitton Lock Me Supple
